body_html:
@zakizhou
I managed to "fix" the problem by changing the CUDA path and LD_LIBRARY_PATH. For some reason, instead of showing that it couldn't find a CUDA related library it just segfaults.

For me the problem was that Ubuntu really messes things up while installing Nvidia and CUDA. There was like four different folders for CUDA inside /use/local/.

Unfortunately, fixing for PyTorch broke Tensorflow in a way I couldn't even reinstall it.
Long story short, I've removed Ubuntu and installed Manjaro. Installed both tensorflow and PyTorch from AUR. Got everything working nice and shine within minutes.

@soumith
Thanks for your time and patience. It is solved for me.
